result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Marie Ruscher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heather Marie Ruscher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heather Marie Ruscher was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 31, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF24.
$38.00 witness fees to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF24.

Parenting classes at the discretion of Agent.
Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Heather Marie Ruscher appeared.  Court called.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads NO Contest to Ct 2 with the domestic abuse stricken.  No Contest plea is entered.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- DE to serve 20 days in the St. Croix County Jail - stayed and used at the discretion of the probation agent. 
- Parenting classes at the discretion of the probation agent.
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid through the DOC
- DE to report to probation today - 07/31/15
- Bail is continued until the DE reports to probation and then is vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 31, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Heather Marie Ruscher appeared.  Court called at 3:47 p.m.  Attorney Andrea advises there is a resolution but the Victim needs to be contacted.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.   Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:49 p.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Jennifer Anne Bork, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF:  Heather Marie Ruscher appeared.  Court called at 11:20 a.m.  S/T of Deputy Greg Moen of the Dunn County Sheriff's Office.  Direct by ADA Bork.  State's Ex. 1 (Photo) O/R.  State's Ex. 2 (Photo) O/R.  State's Ex. 3 (Photo) O/R.  DE is identified by Deputy Moen.  Cross by Attorney Andrea. Re-direct by ADA Bork.  Re-Cross by Attorney Andrea.  Witness excused.  State rests.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Court sets out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 11:35 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Appointing Atty Andrea. km
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.P.M. dob 3/23/03.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
